content: felted bowls simple versatile bowls in two sizes ideal for first time knitting in the round or felting by kelly kingston for tangled yarns finished measurements this may vary depending on how much you felt the bowls worsted weight approximately 7cm height 13cm diameter super bulky weight approximately 8cm height 16cm diameter gauge is not critical for this pattern as long as you are happy with the fabric created this may affect the final size of the project along with the yarn amounts required materials yarn - 65g / 130 metres of worsted total amount hold double stranded 120g / 100 metres of super bulky needles - 8 00mm worsted or 10 00mm bulky 40cm circular needle plus corresponding double point needles or 80cm circular needle for magic loop notions - scissors darning needle stitch marker s and a washing machine for felting pattern notes k - knit p - purl k2tog - knit two stitches together pm - place marker pattern using 8 00mm 10 00mm circular needles cast on 63 stitches being careful not to twist your stitches place marker we have endeavoured to ensure these instructions are accurate and complete however we cannot be held responsible for variations in individual work human error or if yarn other than recom- mended is used if you have any queries please contact us at tangled@tangledyarns com au this pattern is protected by copyright © and cannot be copied under any circumstances items knitted from this pattern cannot be used for commercial purposes page 1 of 2 pm join to knit in the round knit 20 rounds in garter stitch k one round p one round the easiest way to count the rounds in garter stitch is to count the garter stitch ridges you will decrease for the base of the basket over the next 13 rounds round 1 *k2tog k7 repeat from * until end of round 56 stitches round 2 purl round 3 *k2tog k6 repeat from * until end of round 49 stitches round 4 purl round 5 *k2tog k5 repeat from * until end of round 42 stitches round 6 purl round 7 *k2tog k4 repeat from * until end of round 35 stitches round 8 purl round 9 *k2tog k3 repeat from * until end of round 28 stitches round 10 purl round 11 *k2tog repeat from * until end of round 14 stitches round 12 purl round 13 *k2tog repeat from * until end of round 7 stitches cut yarn leaving a 6 inch tail with darning needle thread tail through the remaining 7 stitches before removing the needle and pull tight to close the base of the bowl weave in ends felt by putting finished bowl through a hot wash in the washing machine with an old tennis ball or pair of jeans for extra agitation we have endeavoured to ensure these instructions are accurate and complete however we cannot be held responsible for variations in individual work human error or if yarn other
